intro: Ficus microtus var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the rainforests of Borneo and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fig fruits. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of about 2–3 meters. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
